poem:
"Traversing the Baltic Chills" 

Flirting with bergs on
a frozen lake, Estonia 
breaks through her shell. 

The truck, heavy with
stories, halts - a dread
of fallen ice whispers.

Leathered feet, greet slush,
meet chunks, the engine hums -
resumes her narrative.
  
Estonia blooms,
from ice to spring's promise -  
a tale, told on wheels.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Breaking the ice – Estonia comes in from the cold “First we have to cross the icebergs,” our guide, Herling Mesi, says, pointing to a barely visible ridge on the otherwise flat expanse of frozen lake. Interactive She is worried that a patch of broken ice won’t take the weight of the truck with all its passengers, so we climb out, walk over the slushy chunks, then hop back in. As with many vehicles from". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
